intro: Calystegia spithamaea subsp. spithamaea, commonly known as the creeping morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pale blue to violet in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its rapid growth and invasive potential make it both ecologically significant and a challenge in certain environments.
